result.execSummary:
The defendant Frank Rauls was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Frank Rauls

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: filed and signed by the Court, As to Count 1:  The petition for sentence adjustment is denied because it is not in the public interest.  Copies forwarded to parties.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. William S. Pocan, Br. 26, for review. jbs

Defendant Frank Rauls in court with Attorney Mary Garvin-Guimont.  Defendant in custody.  Tyrone Martin St Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.     Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.   

Court sentenced defendant to pay a FINE of $1,800.00  PLUS all costs, penalties and surcharges to be collected by DOC out of up to 25% prison wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be etnered.
Court ordered Intoxicated Driver Assessment; form filed; copy to defendant.
Court ordered defendant's driving privileges revoked for 2 years.
Court ordered ignition interlock for a period 2 years, consecutive to revocation.  IID surcharges and/or fees to apply.  

 The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 4 years, consecutive to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 2 years with credit for 195 days
time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 years.
Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:  
 

*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*Maintain absolute sobriety.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he/she may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge and IID surcharges and fees, out of up to 25% prison wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- Defendant does not qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program but does qualify for the the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 1/2 initial confinement.
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court, defendant Frank Rauls not in court, in custody.  Tyrone Martin St Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 12, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Frank Rauls in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Frank Rauls in custody.  James Griffin for Tyrone Martin St Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Jessica Lowery-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 34.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER TO WCS  for supervision upon release for the Repeat Intoxicated Driver Program.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by SCRAM, drug tests and portable breathalyzers.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Frank Rauls in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Frank Rauls in custody.  Joanne L. Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 27, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
